page.title: 02HOUSING ALLERTHORPE
page.content: HOUSING; ALLERTHORPE; pop.180. This village has an access road from the A 1079. The village is residential,apart from the farms surrounding it, the only commercial aspect being an inn at the West of the thoroughfare,The village hall is also to the West (this is used for social gatherings, Whist Drives, Fairs, etc. There are 4 rented dwellings, these being council built (Airey Houses) the rest of the houses 32 in all, are all owner/occupied. Houses as they become vacant have been bought by retired business persons, or people who prefer to commute. When we visited Allerthorpe it was a dry sunny day during school holidays and yet there was not a child to be seen or heard. St. Botolph's Church with graveyard, the earliest grave readable was l861
